intro: Helianthemum mutabile var. multiplex, commonly known as the variable rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, with woody stems and dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink and red, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This species is well adapted to rocky and sunny environments, often thriving in well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
